FHIR-v3-Address-Use (http://hl7.org/fhir/ConceptMap/101)

Mapping from http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/address-use to http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-AddressUse

DRAFT (not intended for production usage). Published on 2012-06-13 by HL7, Inc (FHIR project team (example): http://hl7.org/fhir). Creative Commons 0

A mapping between the FHIR and HL7 v3 AddressUse Code systems


Source CodeRelationshipDestination CodeComment
Mapping from AddressUse to AddressUse
homeis equivalent toH (home)
workis equivalent toWP (work place)
tempis equivalent toTMP (temporary address)
oldis not related toBAD (bad address)In the HL7 v3 AD, old is handled by the usablePeriod element, but you have to provide a time, there's no simple equivalent of flagging an address as old

resource.name: FHIR-v3-Address-Use
resource.title: FHIR/v3 Address Use Mapping
resource.description: A mapping between the FHIR and HL7 v3 AddressUse Code systems
resource.purpose: To help implementers map from HL7 v3/CDA to FHIR

target.comment: In the HL7 v3 AD, old is handled by the usablePeriod element, but you have to provide a time, there's no simple equivalent of flagging an address as old

text.div:
SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM mappings for fracture of ulna (http://hl7.org/fhir/ConceptMap/103)

Mapping from http://snomed.info/sct?fhir_vs to http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-us

DRAFT (not intended for production usage). Published on 2012-06-13 by HL7, Inc (FHIR project team (example): http://hl7.org/fhir). Creative Commons 0

Example rule-based mappings between SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM for fracture of ulna


Source CodeRelationshipDestination CodeComment
Mapping from http://snomed.info/sct|March 2015 US Edition to http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-us|2015
263204007narrowerS52.209AThe target mapping to ICD-10-CM is narrower, since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent) and fracture type is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.
narrowerS52.209DThe target mapping to ICD-10-CM is narrower, since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent), fracture type and healing (for subsequent encounter) is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.

resource.name: SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM mappings for fracture of ulna
resource.description: Example rule-based mappings between SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM for fracture of ulna

target.comment: The target mapping to ICD-10-CM is narrower, since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent) and fracture type is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.

The target mapping to ICD-10-CM is narrower, since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent), fracture type and healing (for subsequent encounter) is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.

resource.name: Specimen mapping from v2 table 0487 to SNOMED CT

target.comment: HL7 term is a historical term. mapped to Pus
Be more specific use either: 119326000^hair specimen or 119327009^nail specimen

Prefer to have aspirate of the pus oozing out from cleaned insertion site - if swab is all that can be obtained, then swab after cleaning, otherwise you may get a contaminated specimen and a falsely identified infected central line. Do not just swab the reddened area - that will just collect skin flora
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead: not an acceptable specimen for micro - not specific enough term
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead
this term is not specific enough, choose from terms that more accurately describe the specimen
Further describe the sample as tissue or pus. or by the collection method. The term boil is not specific to a body site - need to indicate source site (spm.8). preferred term is Aspirate_Boil
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead: stool is what is expected, should use stool sample
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead: stool is what is expected, should use stool sample
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead
should be more specific what kind of lesion is observed - be more specific is it a wound, abscess, mass - specify! Ask SNOMED CT to mark it as a grouper term only (309049000)
The HL7 term is a historical term Mapped to CSF obtained by lumbar puncture
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead
Historical term - consider what is being drained and indicate that in SPM-4 instead
Historical term -though in this case more often used for discharge
